entry.title: SAP BTP Identity Service returning UUID instead of email in req.user.id
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I'm using SAP BTP Identity Authentication Service (IAS) as the Identity Provider for a Node.js application running on BTP (Kyma Runtime).
During the authentication flow, I noticed that some users appear with a UUID as their userName, which affects the value received in req.user.id. I was expecting the user email, but I'm getting something like 4fbe5b7e-e408-4fe3-9153-f58d22....

Context:

Identity Provider is accounts.ondemand.com (business users).

In the same subaccount, other users are correctly identified by their email addresses.

This inconsistency breaks validations that expect the email as the user identifier.

Question:

Has anyone experienced this behavior before?

Is there a way to configure IAS or the trust setup in BTP to ensure the email is used as the userName?

Or is there a mapping or attribute transformation needed (e.g., in the JWT claims)?

Screenshot attached as an example.

entry.title: Issue with Destination Visibility in Cloud Identity Services ‚Äì Connectivity Plan Required or Workaro
entry.content:
We are currently facing an issue when attempting to create a Source System in the Identity Provisioning Service. Specifically, the destination we've configured in our SAP BTP subaccount isn't appearing as an option in Cloud Identity Services. Based on our research, it seems we may need to create a Cloud Identity Services Connectivity Plan within the same subaccount, as suggested by this community thread: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/no-destination-available-at-identity-provisioning-service/qaq-p/12609309.

We have been following this comprehensive guide to enable Joule capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/joule-for-sap-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-a-comprehensive-setup-guide/ba-p/13786453.

However, we encountered an error while trying to create this Connectivity Plan, matching the scenario described in SAP Knowledge Base Article 3462424: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3462424.

Could the absence of this Connectivity Plan indeed be the root cause of our issue, or is there an alternative workaround available that would allow the already-created BTP destination to appear within the Cloud Identity Services? Any insights or guidance from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: How to map custom attributes and groups from IdP(OIDC) to a Fiori App via SAP CIS?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I have a Fiori application on SAP BTP using a proxied trust setup: BTP -> CIS -> AWS Cognito.

I have successfully configured the trust, and users can log in. The standard attributes (first name, last name, email) appear correctly in my application.

The Problem: I cannot get custom attributes and user groups from Cognito to appear in my app's user session.

What I Have Done:

  1. Cognito: I have confirmed that my Cognito ID Token contains the custom attributes. The audit log in CIS shows the payload it receives from Cognito includes:

    • "custom: country": "Australia"

    • "cognito: groups": ["BTP_Viewers"]

  2. SAP BTP (xs-security.json): I have declared that my application wants to receive these attributes:

{
  "xsappname": "sap-fiori-hello-world",
  "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
  "description": "Hello World SAP Fiori app with AWS Cognito authentication via CIS",
  "scopes": [
    {
      "name": "openid",
      "description": "Default scope for all authenticated users."
    }
  ],
  "attributes": [
    {
      "name": "given_name",
      "description": "User's First Name",
      "valueType": "string"
    },
    {
      "name": "family_name",

      "valueType": "string"

      "valueType": "string",
      "valueRequired": false
    },
    {
      "name": "custom_country",

      "valueType": "string"

    "redirect-uris": [
      "https://*.*.hana.ondemand.com/**",
      "https://*.*.hana.ondemand.com/login/callback"
    ]
  }
}
  • SAP CIS: I have enabled Identity Federation ("Use Identity Authentication user store") on my Corporate Identity Provider settings for Cognito.

    The Result:

    When I check the /user-api/attributes endpoint in my Fiori app, I only see the standard attributes. The groups and custom_country attributes are missing.

  "name": "my@email.com",
  "scopes": [
    "openid"

}

 

My Question:

Since the data is arriving at CIS from Cognito but not reaching my BTP application, what is the exact and final step required within SAP Cloud Identity Services to map these custom attributes (custom: country) and groups (cognito: groups) so they are included in the token sent to BTP?

I suspect I am missing a mapping on the application level within CIS, and I would appreciate help here.

Thank you

entry.title: Multiple employments in Workzone, how do you handle user multiple employment user data?
entry.content:
Within SuccessFactors you can have multiple employments at the same time, this is typically for global assignment / international mobility use cases. This means both records are active at the same time, the user has one email address, etc. They are for our purposes the same user in WorkZone. 

WorkZone only has 1 profile for each user and then has an employment switcher in the top right when you have multiple employments, this essentially switches the active 'userId' when interacting with UI cards.

However, how do people handle access to workspaces based on employment data? Keeping the example simple is as follows:

Regardless of execution of the records, only one of them will fill in the country field. So, the answer I thought was simply using custom attributes! Do a check based on primary assignment, fill the address for Country A and custom attribute for Country B. However, WorkZone does not support PATCH requests so will delete data if not filled in.

So, how do others do it? How do you take employee data from 2 records and merge them into WorkZone using IPS? I can imagine how to do it using other tools, because you would GET all the existing data and just pass in the additional data. OR obviously PATCH requests would be excellent if supported and make this a non issue, but sadly they are not. 

What are others doing in this instace? Handling workspace assignments using something other than dynamic user lists? We've also used SF Permission Groups synced into WZ, however we hit a technical limit of groups (~100) so need to ideally use dynamic user lists/ something automatic not based on permission groups.

entry.title: email not received in post user creation SCIM cloud identity services
entry.content:
I am currently working with SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS), automating user creation through the SCIM API. My goal is to have users receive the standard activation (welcome) email as soon as they are created and activated via the API, just as they do when activated manually through the IAS web interface.

Steps taken:

  1. POST /scim/Users
    I create the user with the following call:
JSON
 
{
  "schemas": ["urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"],
  "userName": "Dave.test",
  "name": {
    "familyName": "Dave",
    "givenName": "Dave"
  },
  "emails": [
    {
      "value": "dave.test@gmail.com",
      "primary": true
    }
  ],
  "active": false
}
  1. PATCH /scim/Users/{id}
    I then activate the user with this PATCH request:
JSON
 
{
  "schemas": ["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:PatchOp"],
  "Operations": [
    {
      "op": "Replace",
      "path": "active",
      "value": true
    }
  ]
}
  1. User status verification:
    After the PATCH, the user status is "active": true both via API and in the IAS interface.

Observed behavior:

  • When I activate the user through the IAS interface, the activation/welcome email is sent immediately.
  • When I activate the user via SCIM API, the user is marked as active, but the activation email is not sent.
  • The email template is active and works (tested via UI), the email infrastructure (SMTP) is correct, and the emails do not end up in spam.
  • I do not have access to a Monitoring/Email Delivery section in IAS to check if the email was attempted.

How can i fix?

Thanks
